intro: Kundmannia anatolica, commonly known as the Anatolian kundmannia, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Kundmannia anatolica has slender, branching stems and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
